text:
e="preserve">Dorothy Maclean (January 7, 1920 in Guelph, Ontario - March 13, 2020 in Findhorn) was a Canadian writer and educator. Her works were about spiritual subjects. Maclean was known for her work with "devas", said to be intelligences overseeing the natural world. Her best known book was "To Hear the Angels Sing".
She turned 100 in January 2020 and died shortly after on March 13, 2020, in Findhorn.
